Anyone who gives this ap less than five stars is an ignorant fool.  Absolute must have for anyone seriously committed to mathematical education by actually learning the material and actually working through textbook problems.  This ap basically gives you the ability to automatically factor polynomials as you develop proofs thereby getting you to the end result step by step.  Not for fools this is a tool for learning and man aid to developing formal proofs by allowing you to troubleshoot each step as you go without having to constantly reference tables of identities.  Basically an abstract algebra calculator much cheaper than their full product Mathematica.
For anyone that needs to do math and does have the time to do the working this app is fantastic.

While I haven't used any other functionality, its math-related abilities are incredible.

As an early-level engineering student, the math I'm typically dealing with can be difficult to calculate, and in some cases, I'm unable to check my answer to fully make sure I'm understanding it. Wolfram Alpha helps me make sure I know that I got the correct answer.

While its Boolean algebra abilities can be limited, it's amazing at differentiation and integration. By extension, it's been an incredible tool when using Laplace Transformation, as well as it's inverse operation, even in plain-text input

It's plain-text abilities supersede any other math tool, and I can honestly say I use this app (and it's website) far more often than the program the school pays for. The additional keyboard with special symbols for math (such as an integral key and a square root key) are only bonuses.

If you haven't used this app or this website, I definitely recommend it, even for its limitless non-math abilities.

As can be gathered from the title, I truly love this app. It is crucial for my chemistry and pre-calc grades. I'm not cheating, mind you, I just can't hear a single word my professor says. Anything you can think of, Wolfram has it. Amazing.
Person story here: I have ideasthesia, a mental condition in which I see numbers as specific colours. Usually it's factor based. Wolfram is the system I used to find said factors to see if I was correct. For example, I know instantly that 70,560 has a negative,neutral,positive, and a 7, but I don't know their powers. (Hint: it's (2^5)(3^2)(7^2)(5)) Wolfram makes it simple to calculate these, no powerful computers needed. 
Truly, and invaluable tool. All others who say different are simply not intellectuals.

Picture upload just analyses the image properties, but doesn't search for results that may be related to the image. I'm extremely impressed by the app's ability to correctly identify the goal of a query and formulate a responsive answer, but hugely disappointed by the lack of current data. Queries on GDP and business formation in EU countries, e.g., produced great tables and ranking results, with impressive detail, but based on 2010 and 2008 data, respectively (with 2011 estimates in the case of GDPs). Good for a historian, but not worth much for current economic analysis. If Wolfram could tap the current data available from the EU, World Bank, IMF and the public CIA Factbook and State Department country summaries, it would become a viable economic analysis tool. At present, it's not.

This application is incredible!  Performs all kinds of statistical analysis rapidly.  This application is a must-have app for the IPad.  Everyday I find new and unique uses for this app.  Thank you very much!!!!
Pure genius.
Without this app, I would have not have passed my engineering class! The equations are all broken down in tables, which makes it very easy to understand. I couldn't reccomend this highly enough!
It really Rocks!
Absolutely great for astonishing amounts of information. Just remember, though, even Capt. Kirk got p.o.'d at the computer from time to time. Try asking why are we here. :-) and have a lovely day!

I downloaded this app because I saw how useful it could be in my schoolwork, especially Calculus. 
But with the way it crashes ever so often, this app becomes a drag and keeps getting me very upset. 
I really wish this bug could be fixed before it bugs me and everyone else who spent 4 dollars on it out.

This is a fantastic app...when it works. I use it constantly to check my work and it is consistently accurate. However, it crashes far more than I consider normal and I find it extremely frustrating to have to start completely over when it loses all of my work.  For now, I'll continue using it because I have yet to find a good substitution. The moment I do, I'll be using that instead.
It's very helpful, I use this to learn faster than I learn at school!
A $4 app that can easily do things a $200 can't, totally worth it.

If you attempt to put in a transfer function other than the default when using the Bode plot functionality, it throws an error. If you type in a random equation into the Bode dialog, evaluate it, and then paste in the original default equation of 1/(-2+s^2), it throws the same error. Thus, no matter what you put in you always get an error and never get a plot. The same issue occurs with the Nyquist dialog.

This is an idea whose time has come. I just discovered it last night, so there's no way this review can be complete--but this app is completely satisfying to my number-loving soul. Off to go integrate something....

Wolfram Alpha is, by far, one of the greatest mathematical, or even informational, apps out then. Basically everything you out in there, including the Ultimate Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything. But the only problem is that the application crashes when I try to use the other numerical keyboard. Not all the times, but mostly. So, hopefully that can be fixed. But other than that, great app.

Occasionally this app does great things  but more often than not it just frustrates the hell out of me. If it doesn't like your input it just ignores it. Try putting axes labels on a plot. It will never admit that you can't do it in WA, it just ignores you.   If I stick with small perturbations to the examples it works but try straying from that and you'll drive yourself nuts! It's a minor miracle when it responds to an entire input string. More often than not it ignores half of what I enter with no clue what the problem is. 

I would love to see a Mathematica lite that doesn't cost more than my iPad, most of what I want to do falls into that category, the syntax & rules are structured and the limits of what can and can't be done could be found in a user manual.
This app is basically a giant data base of everything! Very useful to have around.
Helped me so much with my math homework. The best $4 ever spent on an app. Must buy!
Much nicer to use on an iPad than on a computer.
Love the app. I also enjoy cooking for my family. If I were able to search RECIPES for certain dishes on this app it would be absolutely flawless.

Absolutely indispensable and much better than just another search engine.  For example, type 1/2 - 1/3 and get a step by step guide on how to solve it - complete with illustrations.
You can search absolutely anything, but unlike google it's has no ads and doesn't bring up websites because up typed it's or who
